channel.title: Questions to help get me started
channel.description:
Hello, this is my first time posting and I’d like to ask a few questions to get started with making Rsps. The last thing I want to be is another person who asks a ton of obvious questions that annoys more advanced coders/developers. It’d be great if I could get some advice on how to start, simply because this has interested me for a long time and don’t normally enjoy any servers anymore, they all seem neglected by staff, the community is horrible and the items that ruined RS are always there for prices that only donators could afford.
I’ve noticed how all the servers today try to keep updated with runescape which doesn’t make much sense in my opinion, I thought nex armors, SOF, Dicing, etc was what killed Rs and the joy we once got from it. I want to be that one of the few people who still believes every server shouldn’t have a master command, donate for all the good benefits, and nothing past 07 really.
To get started I really don’t know much I’ve been trying to get a grasp on the terms used, what will be good to start with, etc...
[b]Questions[/b]: So question one would be wheres a good place to start with learning to code my own content, I have no prior experience and just here for suggestions. I’ve read jumping straight into it isn’t a good approach.
I’ve narrowed it down to Delta being a good starter to learn from, I’ve also learned that PI is extremely overused and want to get away from the norm, along with the fact its for more experienced people. I want to be original and actually learn how things work such as teleports, skills and how they function, just everything really.
Like I said I want to stick with something like a 317 sense that’s apparently a good starter, I’m also curious as to the differences between a 459 and 474. I only want updates prior to bounty hunter and clan wars while still having classic Wilderness that we’ve all come to love. I believe in a heavily PvM based server while giving people a chance to pk and have fun without overpowered weapons and gear.
I’m also curious as to what exactly can be “ripped” from servers such as maps and other content. I was wondering if it was possible to take PJA’s construction and add it to a better source because from what I’ve read it’s buggy, but comes down to peoples own opinions. I have multiple different downloads to choose from but I’d like to know more before I move onto higher revisions.

item.title: Questions to help get me started
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


Win

[quote=“legitz-x, post:7, topic:458994”]From what i learned to code, i suggest you to download server / client in server downloads list, make sure you get 317, populour base is 317/pi. And look through folders/files. And open java files with notepad++.

Also i suggest looking at snippets to find things you can add to server.

Also there are tuts on this forums aswell just search away.

Otherwise good luck mate.[/quote]

Horrid advise.

1 point.

legitz-x:

make sure you get 317, populour base is 317/pi.

Did you read?

Skyline:

I’ve also learned that PI is extremely overused and want to get away from the norm,

2

legitz-x:

Also i suggest looking at snippets to find things you can add to server.

Your telling him to leech code? That’s the worst way to learn.

Read full topic
item.source: Questions to help get me started

item.title: Questions to help get me started
item.dc:creator: @legitz-x legitz-x
item.description:
@legitz-x wrote:

From what i learned to code, i suggest you to download server / client in server downloads list, make sure you get 317, populour base is 317/pi. And look through folders/files. And open java files with notepad++.

Also i suggest looking at snippets to find things you can add to server.

Also there are tuts on this forums aswell just search away.

Otherwise good luck mate.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions to help get me started
item.dc:creator: @snowmore snowmore
item.description:
@snowmore wrote:

I learned most of my RSPS-making from tinkering and fiddling around with spawns, drops, teleports, small things like that…
There is a near-blank 317 source that you can use to learn the basics, along with a youtube guide or something.

Portforwarding was freakishly annoying…

Read full topic
item.source: Questions to help get me started

item.title: Questions to help get me started
item.dc:creator: @Skyline Skyline
item.description:
@Skyline wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:4, topic:458994”]Buy a book on java, or take an elective at your high school/collage on java programming.
If your even high school yet.[/quote]

I’m currently a junior in High School and we don’t really have anything outside the extremely basic computer classes sadly enough…

Read full topic
item.source: Questions to help get me started

item.title: Questions to help get me started
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:

item.source: Questions to help get me started

item.title: Questions to help get me started
item.dc:creator: @Skyline Skyline
item.description:
@Skyline wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:2, topic:458994”]1). You have to understand the mechanics of the client before you code content. Menu options would be crucial to understand.

2). If you want to learn how things function, don’t use delta or PI. Use a modern base such as one that Graham has created.

3). Most of the 4xx revisions are loading 317 or 508 maps, there isn’t much of a difference. That and content possibly. I don’t know specifically.

4). Ripping content is usually a bad idea. Adapting content is a better route.[/quote]

Thank you for the reply. Is there a base he’s created that you’d suggest me start with or is any good? And maps and pretty much whats displayed on the mini-map correct? I just want it to include hunter icons, Poh icons etc from that time period.

Also the only reason I said anything about ripping content is because the construction on PJA looked like a good started, it wasn’t perfected or completed from what I saw and thought it’d be good to add onto when I’m more familiar with coding.

Also while I’m thinking about it, is it possible to have something like PJA downloaded and use the moparscape client to look around see whats buggy? I was unsure how all that worked for offline use.

Read full topic
item.source: Questions to help get me started

item.title: Questions to help get me started
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Skyline, post:1, topic:458994”]Questions:
So question one would be wheres a good place to start with learning to code my own content, I have no prior experience and just here for suggestions. I’ve read jumping straight into it isn’t a good approach.

I’ve narrowed it down to Delta being a good starter to learn from, I’ve also learned that PI is extremely overused and want to get away from the norm, along with the fact its for more experienced people. I want to be original and actually learn how things work such as teleports, skills and how they function, just everything really.

Like I said I want to stick with something like a 317 sense that’s apparently a good starter, I’m also curious as to the differences between a 459 and 474. I only want updates prior to bounty hunter and clan wars while still having classic Wilderness that we’ve all come to love. I believe in a heavily PvM based server while giving people a chance to pk and have fun without overpowered weapons and gear.

I’m also curious as to what exactly can be “ripped” from servers such as maps and other content. I was wondering if it was possible to take PJA’s construction and add it to a better source because from what I’ve read it’s buggy, but comes down to peoples own opinions. I have multiple different downloads to choose from but I’d like to know more before I move onto higher revisions.[/quote]

1). You have to understand the mechanics of the client before you code content. Menu options would be crucial to understand.

2). If you want to learn how things function, don’t use delta or PI. Use a modern base such as one that Graham has created.

3). Most of the 4xx revisions are loading 317 or 508 maps, there isn’t much of a difference. That and content possibly. I don’t know specifically.

4). Ripping content is usually a bad idea. Adapting content is a better route.

Read full topic
item.source: Questions to help get me started

Like I said I want to stick with something like a 317 sense that’s apparently a good starter, I’m also curious as to the differences between a 459 and 474. I only want updates prior to bounty hunter and clan wars while still having classic Wilderness that we’ve all come to love. I believe in a heavily PvM based server while giving people a chance to pk and have fun without overpowered weapons and gear.

I’m also curious as to what exactly can be “ripped” from servers such as maps and other content.
